summary:
Stock Market Gains: SENSEX Up 400 Points Amid Mixed Performances

Publication Date: January 7, 2024 | Source: [News Website]

The domestic equity market showed positive momentum at the start of trading on Tuesday, with the S&P BSE SENSEX rising significantly, while mixed performances were observed in individual stocks.

  • The S&P BSE SENSEX was up 394.39 points, trading at 78,359.38.
  • The NSE's NIFTY50 index gained 135.60 points, reaching 23,751.65.
  • 43 out of 50 NIFTY50 components were in the green, while Zomato faced a notable decline.
  • Top gainers on the index included ONGC, Titan, and BPCL.
  • Zomato shares dropped over 4% amid concerns over competition.
“2025 could be a breather year for Zomato, with the stock likely shifting gears into a phase of price consolidation.” - Jefferies Analysts

The market showed broad sectoral gains, with oil and gas leading, while foreign institutional investors reportedly sold equities worth ₹2,575.06 crore yesterday.
newTitle: Stock Market Gains: SENSEX Up 400 Points Amid Mixed Performances

title: Nvidia is helping humanoid robots learn through Apple Vision Pro instruction - TechCrunch
summary:
Nvidia is helping humanoid robots learn through Apple Vision Pro instruction

Published on: Not specified Source: TechCrunch

Robotics have significantly contributed to Nvidia’s growth, with the launch of GR00T heralding a pivotal moment in humanoid robotics. The recent addition of Blueprint emphasizes imitation learning, allowing robots to learn skills by mimicking human actions through the Apple Vision Pro.

  • Nvidia's GR00T platform integrates big names in humanoid robotics.
  • Imitation learning enables robots to learn through observation and mimicry.
  • Teleoperation facilitates remote teaching of robotic systems.
  • Apple's Vision Pro is utilized to create digital twins for simulation.
“Imitation learning is what it sounds like. A person performs an action and the robot follows suit.”

The integration of these technologies signals an advancement in how humanoid robots can be trained, potentially revolutionizing their deployment in practical scenarios.
newTitle: Nvidia Enhances Humanoid Robots Learning with Apple Vision Pro

title: Air India flight makes emergency landing after engine shuts off midair - The Hindu
summary:
Air India Flight 2820 Makes Emergency Landing Due to Engine Failure

Date: January 07, 2025 Source: The Hindu

A Delhi-bound Air India flight made an emergency landing after one of its engines shut off midair. The flight, that took off from Kempegowda International Airport in Bengaluru, returned safely with no incidents reported.

  • The incident occurred on January 5, 2024, shortly after takeoff.
  • Flight 2820 took off around 7 p.m. and circled Bengaluru before landing an hour later.
  • All passengers were reported safe with no injuries.
No untoward incident happened and all the passengers were safe.

This emergency landing highlights the importance of aircraft safety and protocol in the aviation industry.
newTitle: Air India Flight 2820 Makes Emergency Landing Due to Engine Failure

title: FIIs bet $1 billion on IT stocks before Q3 results. Does it signal a happy new year? - The Economic Times
summary:
FIIs bet $1 billion on IT stocks before Q3 results. Does it signal a happy new year?

Publication Date: January 9 | Source: Economic Times

Ahead of the Q3 results season, foreign institutional investors (FIIs) have invested over $1 billion in IT stocks, betting on a potential recovery in the sector as macroeconomic conditions improve.

  • FIIs invested Rs 15,446 crore in December, with Rs 9,050 crore specifically in IT stocks.
  • Analysts expect the Q3 results for IT companies to be mixed, but project growth recovery in FY26.
  • HCL Tech is anticipated to report a 3.5% quarter-on-quarter growth, while Wipro is expected to see a -1% impact.
  • Brokerages like Motilal Oswal suggest LTIMindtree as a top pick among Tier-1 players, anticipating better revenue growth fueled by a favorable macro environment.
"As we head into 2025, the macroeconomic environment is far better placed than it has been in the last two years." - Kumar Rakesh, BNP Paribas Analyst

This heavy investment from FIIs may indicate confidence in the Indian IT sector's recovery as they expect improved discretionary spending in the near future.
newTitle: FIIs Invest $1 Billion in IT Stocks Ahead of Q3 Results

title: Sony and Honda's new Afeela electric car to start at $89,900, but only for buyers in California - Hindustan Times
summary:
Sony and Honda Launch Afeela Electric Car Starting at $89,900, Initially for California Buyers

Date: Jan 07, 2025 08:30 AM IST Source: Hindustan Times

Sony and Honda have teamed up to introduce the 'Afeela,' an electric vehicle (EV) available for pre-orders at CES 2025 in Las Vegas. Initially, the car will be sold only in California.

  • The Afeela comes in two trims: Afeela 1 Origin at $89,900 and Afeela 1 Signature at $102,900.
  • Includes a three-year subscription to in-car features like Level 2+ driver assist and AI-powered personal assistant.
  • Offers up to 300 miles of EPA-estimated range and supports Tesla's Supercharger network.
  • Initial delivery for Signature trim starts in 2026, while Origin will follow in 2027.
  • Features advanced technology including 40 sensors, cameras, and potential augmented reality integration.
“Come on out, Afeela” - Yasuhide Mizuno, CEO of Sony Honda Mobility.

The Afeela represents a significant step in Sony and Honda's collaboration, reflecting the rising demand for EVs. Details on shopping for the vehicle will be announced soon.
newTitle: Sony and Honda Launch Afeela Electric Car Starting at $89,900, Initially for California Buyers

title: Stocks to watch, January 7: Manappuram Finance, Bharti Airtel, Vodafone Idea, BPCL, Bajaj Finserv, Kalyan Jewellers, and more - Upstox
summary:
Stocks to Watch, January 7

Date: January 7, 2024

Source: Market Insights

The domestic equity market is expected to open positively today, following a rise in Asian shares and on the back of hopes for a less aggressive tariff approach from the incoming US President.

  • Bajaj Finserv: Reported a general insurance premium of ₹1,331 crore and life insurance premium of ₹1,055 crore for December.
  • Kalyan Jewellers: Achieved a consolidated revenue growth of approximately 39% YoY, with India operations up 41%.
  • Adani Enterprises: Entered a joint venture with Thailand's Indorama Resources for petrochemicals.
  • Manappuram Finance: Confirmed a daylight robbery incident at a branch in Odisha, with a loss of gold and cash.
  • ICICI Prudential Life: Received a GST tax demand order for FY2019 to FY2021.
  • Caplin Point: Received an Establishment Inspection Report from the US FDA with zero observations.
  • BPCL, GAIL, IGL: Maharashtra Natural Gas plans to launch an IPO exceeding ₹1,000 crore.
  • M&M: Increased production by 19.92% year-on-year in December 2024.
  • Bharti Airtel, Vodafone Idea: Agreed to sell their stakes in Firefly Networks to iBus Network.
“The company remains on track to achieve double-digit growth for the full financial year.” - SH Kelkar

The market's positive outlook today reflects various key developments, and investors are advised to watch these stocks closely.
newTitle: Stocks to Watch on January 7: Key Market Moves

title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO Listing Date, Share Price LIVE: Stock to list on the NSE and the BSE today - Upstox
summary:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO Listing Date, Share Price LIVE

Date: January 7, 2023
Source: Upstox

The shares of Indo Farm Equipment were listed at a premium on the National Stock Exchange, reflecting strong investor interest during the IPO.

  • Shares debuted at ₹256, a premium of 19.07% over the issue price of ₹215.
  • The current stock price as of 10:39 am is ₹282.21, up 10.24%.
  • The IPO was subscribed 229.68 times, indicating high demand.
  • The minimum lot size for retail investors was set at 69 shares.
  • Proceeds from the IPO will be used for business expansion and loan repayment.
"The non-institutional investors led the demand, subscribing 503.83 times their portion."

The successful listing of Indo Farm Equipment's shares marks a significant event in the financial market, showcasing the company's strong market interest and backing by investors.

title: Zomato Cut To Hold By Jefferies As Quick Commerce Race Poses Threat To Profitability - NDTV Profit
summary:
Zomato Cut To 'Hold' By Jefferies As Quick Commerce Race Poses Threat To Profitability

Date: 07 Jan 2025

Source: NDTV Profit

Zomato Ltd. has seen its shares downgraded by Jefferies to 'hold', citing increased competition that threatens its profitability.

  • Analysts expect a consolidation year after the stock's value doubled in 2024.
  • Jefferies lowered its target price for Zomato shares from Rs 335 to Rs 275.
  • Rivals like Swiggy have also experienced significant growth post-listing.
  • The company faces challenges from new entrants in the quick commerce space.
“We are worried about the rise in quick commerce competition,” said Jefferies analysts.

The significance of this downgrade reflects the competitive landscape that food delivery services like Zomato must navigate in the coming quarters.
newTitle: Zomato Downgraded to 'Hold' Amid Rising Competition

  • Citi's top property pick is Phoenix Mills, indicating growth potential.

  • InCred maintained an 'add' rating for Shriram Finance with a target price of Rs 4,250.

This analysis offers insights into market sentiments and potential stocks for investors to watch closely.

title: IGL can unlock value for its shareholders courtesy of a new listing; Details here - CNBCTV18
10 Features The Hyundai Creta Electric Borrows From Its ICE Version - CarDekho
summary:
Hyundai Creta Electric vs The Creta: 10 Features Electric Version Borrows From ICE Model

Publication Date: Scheduled for January 17, 2025
Source: CarDekho.com

Hyundai has unveiled the features of the upcoming Creta Electric, which shares styling and cabin layout with the ICE-powered model. The report highlights ten key features focused on convenience and safety borrowed from the regular Creta.

  • Dual 10.25-inch screens for infotainment and digital driver display.
  • Panoramic sunroof available in both models.
  • 8-speaker Bose sound system for premium audio experience.
  • Ventilated front-row seats for comfort.
  • Dual-zone automatic climate control for personalized comfort.
  • Standard 6 airbags across all variants for safety.
  • 360-degree camera system for parking assistance.
  • Level-2 ADAS for advanced safety features.
  • All-wheel disc brakes with electronic parking brake.
  • Tyre pressure monitoring system for real-time alerts.
“Prices for the Hyundai Creta Electric are set to be announced on January 17, 2025, at the upcoming Bharat Mobility Expo.”

The Creta Electric aims to compete with models like Tata Curvv EV, MG ZS EV, and Maruti Suzuki e Vitara.
newTitle: Hyundai Creta Electric vs The Creta: Key Features Borrowed from the ICE Model

The Indian stock market is anticipated to open higher on January 7 following positive trends in global markets, despite experiencing a significant downturn on January 6.

  • Benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty 50 fell sharply on January 6, with Sensex dropping 1,258.12 points and Nifty 50 slipping below 23,700.
  • Gift Nifty indicates a potential upward opening for Nifty 50.
  • Short-term trends suggest potential further weakness with next support levels around 23,500 to 23,400.

title: Big 4 in India outshine MNC parents; combined revenue seen at over Rs 45,000 crore in FY25 - The Economic Times
summary:
Big 4 in India outshine MNC parents; combined revenue seen at over Rs 45,000 crore in FY25

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Economic Times

The Indian arms of the Big Four consulting firms are projected to surpass Rs 45,000 crore in combined revenue in FY25, driven by significant growth in consulting services amidst a slowing economy.

  • The Indian affiliates of Deloitte, PwC, EY, and KPMG outpaced their global parents in FY24 revenue growth.
  • Estimated revenue for the Indian firms in FY24 was around Rs 38,500-38,800 crore.
  • Consulting services generated over Rs 25,000 crore for these firms in FY24.
  • EY is expected to grow 23-25% in FY25, with a focus on consulting services.
  • Tax services across firms generated over Rs 6,000 crore in FY24, with growth expected between 12% and 23% in FY25.
“We will grow 23-25% in FY25. For Deloitte India now, more than 60% of revenue comes from various consulting services.” - Romal Shetty, CEO, Deloitte South Asia.

The growth prospects remain strong for the Big Four in India, as they adapt to changing market demands while facing challenges related to workload management and revenue-sharing with global partners.
newTitle: Big 4 in India outshine MNC parents; combined revenue seen at over Rs 45,000 crore in FY25

title: Higher Returns For Investors Aged 80+, SBI Launches Special FD For Super Senior Citizens, Know Details - News18
summary:
Higher Returns For Investors Aged 80+, SBI Launches Special FD For Super Senior Citizens

Last Updated: January 06, 2025, 21:37 IST

SBI has launched a new variant of term deposit ‘SBI Patrons’ for Super Senior Citizens. This scheme aims to provide greater financial benefits to individuals aged 80 and above.

  • ‘SBI Patrons’ offers an interest rate of 10 bps above the card rates for senior citizens.
  • Available to existing and new term deposit customers.
  • Eligibility extends to individuals aged 80 and above, either singly or jointly.
  • Minimum deposit amount is Rs 1,000, with a maximum of less than Rs 3 crore.
  • Deposit period ranges from 7 days to 10 years.
“Recognition of patronage of Super Senior Citizens by providing them additional benefits in terms of rate of interest.”

This scheme reflects SBI's commitment to supporting the financial needs of senior citizens, ensuring they receive higher returns on their investments.
newTitle: Higher Returns For Investors Aged 80+, SBI Launches Special FD For Super Senior Citizens

title: Infosys Postpones Salary Hikes; Know IT Company's Plan On Pay Increment - News18
summary:
Infosys Delays Salary Hikes: New Pay Increment Plans Revealed

Date: January 06, 2025

Source: Moneycontrol

Infosys, India’s second-largest IT services company, is postponing its annual salary hikes to the fourth quarter of FY25 due to a volatile global market impacting discretionary IT services.

  • The previous round of salary revisions occurred in November 2023.
  • Other major IT firms like HCLTech and LTIMindtree are also deferring pay raises.
  • Some increments will take effect in January, with the remainder in April 2025.
  • Infosys reported a 2.2% sequential increase in net profit but fell short of market expectations.
  • Analysts predict potential margin pressure in the December quarter due to seasonal furloughs.
“In today’s uncertain economic environment, holding on to a job itself is being viewed by many as a significant advantage.”

Infosys continues to offer selective increments to high-performing employees in specialized fields despite the overall salary freeze.
newTitle: Infosys Delays Salary Hikes: New Pay Increment Plans Revealed

title: Winklevoss Twins' Gemini Will Pay $5 Million to Settle CFTC Bitcoin Futures Lawsuit - Decrypt
summary:
Winklevoss Twins' Gemini Will Pay $5 Million to Settle CFTC Bitcoin Futures Lawsuit

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Decrypt

The Gemini Trust Company has agreed to a $5 million settlement with the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) to resolve allegations of misleading regulators regarding its Bitcoin futures product.

  • The settlement avoids a trial that was set for January 21, 2025.
  • Gemini did not admit to or deny any wrongdoing.
  • The CFTC filed the lawsuit accusing Gemini of making material false statements to obtain approval for its Bitcoin futures.
  • The lawsuit claimed Gemini should have known its statements were misleading.
  • Winklevoss twins have been influential in the crypto space and made donations to political campaigns.
“Gemini knew or reasonably should have known that the statements and information by the company were false or misleading.”

This settlement showcases the ongoing regulatory scrutiny in the cryptocurrency sector and the efforts by firms to comply with regulations.
newTitle: Winklevoss Twins' Gemini to Settle CFTC Case with $5 Million Payment
